content.title: Intro
content.content:
Sources

-n is a Quenya suffix that has three meanings.

content.title: -n1
content.content: Used as a dative ending to indicate the indirect object of a sentence. For example in nin "for me" [1] and '''enyalien "in memory of".[2]

content.title: -n2
content.content: -n or -nye is a pronominal ending, 1st person singular "I". It is used to indicate an action is being completed by the speaker. For example, -n is used as a modifier in Elendil's Oath, to form utúlien "I am come" from utúlie "has come".[3] [4]

content.title: -n3
content.content: Used as a plural sign used of the cases.[5][examples needed]
